First, we need to understand what the Gulf of Mexico is and its weather patterns. The Gulf of Mexico is a large body of water located in the southern part of the United States, bordered by the states of Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and Florida. It is known to be prone to hurricanes and tropical storms, particularly during hurricane season, which runs from June 1st to November 30th. 

Next, we need to consider the time of year that a Halloween cruise in the Gulf of Mexico would take place. Since Halloween falls on October 31st, we can assume that the cruise would be taking place sometime in late October. During this time, hurricane season is still in full swing, and there is a higher likelihood of tropical storms and hurricanes forming. 

Given all of this information, we can conclude that a Halloween cruise in the Gulf of Mexico is not likely to be safe from storms. The Gulf of Mexico has a history of severe weather during this time of year, and it is best to err on the side of caution and avoid booking a cruise during hurricane season.
